title: Web-Based Science Learning Motivation Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Science fundamentals and job-related core concept understanding
context.additional_context: A science learning motivation enhancement program conducted in smartphone-centric limited technology environments. Learning outcomes measured through project-based assessments, emphasizing self-directed inquiry using web-based learning tools (Web-LE).

learning_goals: Learners enhance learning motivation by more than 20% through scientific inquiry activities in web-based learning environments

During a two-week mid-term course, learners will complete two challenging tasks per week (e.g., R&D problem-solving simulations), engage in three or more curiosity-inducing content analyses (science quizzes, case studies), achieve 80%+ participation in interactive learning activities (discussions, feedback sessions) with peers, and create/execute a self-directed learning plan.

Over three weeks, learners will establish project plans for real-world industrial problems (e.g., factory cooling system optimization) applying thermodynamics (energy efficiency calculations) and fluid dynamics (fluid loss analysis), and propose creative solutions that pass peer evaluation (80+ points from four or more out of five peers) and expert review (80+ points from one energy engineering PhD).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
